alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 27 at 9:24PM PST until December 28 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large waves and hazardous surf conditions. Breakers up to 25 feet. Seas falling below 20 feet by 7 AM Wednesday. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Minor beach erosion may damage coastal properties and buildings.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can easily lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
